text:
All our businesses
in other countries
have been acquisitions.

Once we acquire a business,
then we add on organic products

to that business
or growth ideas,

but we don't start
organically in any countries.

It will be very difficult to
take a new brand organically

in the FMCG category, Fast
Moving Consumer Goods category
into other countries.

It will be very costly,
very time consuming.

A good acquisition
makes much more sense.

And what is your
either immediate

or medium or long-term
view on the transference

of the Godrej brand to some
of these acquired entities?
So we're very clear on that.

We have acquired companies
which have a strong brand
in their geographies.

So we don't want to necessarily
take the Godrej brand
into those geographies.

Some new products we may
take with the Godrej brand

once we are already
there, but we strongly
support the local brand.

So, for example, we have a
company in South Africa, which

is very strong in
hair colors and now

leader in about 14 countries
in Africa in hair color, best
in South Africa.

And we've taken our powder
hair color technology,

which that company
when we acquired it

did not have, and we've taken it
but in the Inecto brand, which

is the brand of that
company, [INAUDIBLE],,
the same product as in India.

Here it's sold as Godrej
Powder Hair Color.

In Africa, it's sold as
Inecto Powder Hair Color.
